Shanell
Johnson
This campaign has been for you, the residents and communities of Leyton and Wanstead - you have rallied around me with unconditional love, support and encouragement. Over this campaign, over 150 people have come together to spread a positive message of community, hope, peace and solidarity. Together, we can unite to make real, positive change.
Through the power of people and community spirit, we have; delivered over 100,000 leaflets, engaged with community events, 4 hustings and held 3 Peopleâ€™s Assemblies for you to give a direct mandate on what I should stand for, if elected to Parliament as your local independent candidate.
I am humbled to have spent this campaign engaging with the communities, residences and businesses of Leyton & Wanstead. Receiving endorsements and support from a number of organisations, including; The Muslim Vote, Assemble, Collective, Redbridge Action Group, Redbridge Matters, 4 Day Week Campaign, Transform, Caribbean Labour Solidarity and The Climate Party. This is a grassroots movement and whatever the outcome of the 4 July General Election, I will continue to stand up for local voices and campaign for accountability in politics.
I would like to personally thank everyone who came out to vote for me on Thursday 4th July, from a standing start to 9.5% of the vote - I am forever grateful.
From the very bottom of my heart, I want to say, thank you.
Shanell Johnson, Cllr
The election is now over.
Leyton and Wanstead has a new Labour MP.
The UK has a new Labour Government.
